results.title: Get heelers they said it will be fun they said...
results.material_description: Digital screen recording from @sandrastevenjenkins20's Tiktok feed
results.brief_description: Covid Lockdowns prompted many people to get a puppy - but not everyone was ready for the energy bomb of a heeler in their life! This is one of countless social media videos showing footage of heeler puppies chewing, biting, fighting and wriggling their way into the lives of their new humans.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Covid-19 lockdowns prompted many people to get a puppy – but not everyone was ready for the energy bomb of a heeler in their life! This viral video uses the phrasal meme template “X, they said”, which allows people to substitute the X (in this case, heeler puppies) with whatever supposedly fun or simple situation happens to backfire on them. As Know Your Meme outlines, this meme template originated in Warcraft 2 with footmen who would say, “‘Join the army!’, they said. ‘See the world!’, they said… I’d rather be sailing.”
description_for_label: Covid-19 lockdowns prompted many people to get a puppy – but not everyone was ready for the energy bomb of a heeler in their life! This viral video uses a phrasal meme template “X, they said”, which allows people to substitute the X (in this case, heeler puppies) with whatever supposedly fun and simple situation that happens to backfire on them. It originated in Warcraft 2 with footmen who would say, “‘Join the army!’ they said. ‘See the world!’ they said… I’d rather be sailing.”

results.title: Scott no friends
results.brief_description:
This responsive display presents the moment, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

PM Scott Morrison got the cold shoulder at the G20 conference in Rome. His 11th-hour plan for net-zero emissions by 2050 was criticised at home and abroad for lacking any real details, except faith that uninvented tech might save the day, and the French president labelled him a liar over the submarine fiasco. Other world leaders made their displeasure to the government’s handling of recent issues known by collectively shunning the maskless Morrison during a group photo.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Prime Minister Scott Morrison got the cold shoulder at the G20 conference in Rome. Not only did the French president label him a liar over the submarine fiasco, his 11th-hour plan for net-zero emissions by 2050 was criticised around the world (and at home) for lacking any new funding, policies or details – except faith that yet-to-be-invented tech might save the day. Other world leaders made their displeasure known by collectively shunning the maskless Morrison during a group photo opportunity.

While the original footage in this video was broadcast on 7 News, Labor MP Patrick Gorman (and likely his social media team) added the theme music to TV show Curb Your Enthusiasm, equating the Australian Prime Minister with the fictional version of Larry David, whose ignorance and disregard for social conventions results in awkward, cringe-worthy moments on the show. The addition of end cards further establishes the sitcom style, featuring the names of other coalition members, suggesting that the government’s climate policy is a joke that’s resulted in this bumbling Larry David-like instance of international embarrassment.
description_for_label: PM Scott Morrison got the cold shoulder at the G20 conference in Rome. Not only did the French president label him a liar over the submarine fiasco, his 11th-hour plan for net-zero emissions by 2050 was criticised around the world (and at home) for lacking any new funding, policies or details, except faith that uninvented tech might save the day. Other world leaders made their displeasure known by collectively shunning the maskless Morrison during a group photo opportunity.

results.title: Patterns
results.brief_description: Patterns is a documentary which explores issues to do with politics, work, art and women’s history. A number of threads are woven between the sweatshop and the art gallery, the glory box and the political banner, bourgeois femininity and the question: should a feminist knit? An incisive and kaleidoscopic exploration of needlework and its place in women’s lives.

results.title: The Lion King: Simba's Mighty Adventure for Game Boy Color
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, plastic cartridge case, registration card, consumer information booklet and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
Simba’s Mighty Adventure is based on Disney’s The Lion King as well as it’s direct-to-video sequel Simba’s Pride. The game consists of ten side-scrolling levels: The first six are set in The Lion King and the rest in Simba’s Pride, with some levels ending in boss fights. The game tracks along with the plot of both films and follows Simba as he grows up. Key events, such as the stampede from the first film, make up their own levels. Simba moves by running, jumping and climbing. Jumping can also be used to defeat the snakes, spiders, or monkeys that get in Simba’s way. He can also swipe at them with his claw or, as an adult, roar at them to make them flee.

Aiding Simba in his journey are collectibles that grant extra lives, refill or extend Simba’s health or fill a special amulet. Collecting all five parts of the amulet grants an extra life and opens up a mini-game that can be played main menu. The game also has a mulitplayer element. Using a Gameboy Colour link cable with another player opens up an extramode where each player has to hold onto a star for as long as possible by avoiding the opposing player’s attacks.

results.title: Play It Again II: Games Collection
results.brief_description:
The Play It Again II project aims to document, preserve, and create an accessible and playable history of Australasian videogames and videogame culture from the 1990s.

This collection comprises physical games and hardware donated to ACMI for the project and as well as game emulation files created by ACMI or harvested from external web repositories.

The project is being undertaken by ACMI in partnership with Swinburne University, RMIT, AARNet, UNESCO PERSIST and OpenSLX GmbHt.
This project is supported by the Australian Government through the Australian Research Council Linkage Program. Play It Again II is a continuation of Play It Again I, which focused on the preservation of Australasian videogames from the 1980’s.

results.title: Reach for the Stars for PC
results.creator_credit: Strategic Simulations, Inc. and Strategic Studies Group
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD case insert, CD jewel case, licence agreement and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Reach for the Stars is a re-released and updated version of the DOS era game of the same name, the earliest example of a game in the 4X genre. The player starts off in a single planetary system and must eventually create and run an interstellar empire. In typical 4X style, this is done by exploring the universe around the player, expanding by claiming new territory, exploiting any resources in the area and exterminating any opponents along the way. The re-release features updated graphics and new scenarios for the player.

results.title: Dark Reign: The Future of War for PC
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case with insert, manual, product registration card, adverts, internet guide sheet and keyboard reference in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
In the grim future of Dark Reign: The Future of War, the player is caught between two factions at war, the Imperium and the Freedom Guard. The player has a chance to go back in time using a time-travelling device and change history but must first complete a set of trails to activate it. Each of these scenarios has the player recreating past battles between the Imperium and Freedom Guard to prove to hone their martial skills.

Each faction has its own unique units, skills and weaknesses. The Freedom Guard are weaker but more mobile, allowing them to better to be faster and handle difficult terrain. The Imperium, in contrast, have the strength and numbers to overwhelm their enemies but are generally slower. These traits lend themselves to radically different playstyles. A player can also steal the other faction’s technology using a specialized unit, negating their opponent’s advantages. The game features a campaign and map editor and supports online play. In fact, there is still an active community despite the game being over 20 years old.

results.title: Cricket 97: Ashes Tour Edition for PC
results.creator_credit: Electronic Arts and Laser Beam (Beam Software)
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case with insert and manual in a cardboard box
results.brief_description: A sequel to Cricket 96 and an expansion to Cricket 97, Cricket 97: Ashes Tour Edition further improves on the series’ graphics, featuring stadiums rendered in three-dimensions, a series first. Cricketing legends Ritchie Benaud and Ian Botham have been added to provide commentary and are featured in full motion video interludes. The Ashes Tour Edition introduces enhancements such as real players’ names and stats, a larger stadium, an instant replay function, and minor gameplay improvements.

results.title: Carriers at War 1941-1945: Fleet Carrier Operations in the Pacific for DOS
results.material_description: Floppy disk videogame. Two 3 1/2 inch floppy disks, colour map, product registration card, subscription card and manual in a cardboard box
results.brief_description:
Carriers at War 1941-1945: Fleet Carrier Operations in the Pacific is a war simulation game. In the game, the player takes on the role of the task force commander in the Pacific Theater during World War II. The player can play as both the U.S. and the Japanese Empire in scenarios such as Pearl Harbor, Coral Sea, Midway, Eastern Solomons, Santa Cruz and Philippine Sea. The game is played on a 72x84 hexagonal grid on which different units and squadrons, such as naval vessels and land based aircraft, are positioned. The player chooses actions for these units, the consequences for which are simulated by the computer. The game is quasi real-time, meaning that the game can be paused at any given moment at which time the player can give orders to the units. All interaction with the game is through a menu interface. Orders that can be given to units include strike, escort, transport, support, refuel and more complex maneuvers such as strike routines.

Source: Play It Again website:
http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/goldfields/

Last accessed: 6/05/2021

Original game developed by Strategic Studies Group for Commodore 64, published in 1984 by Strategic Studies Group

results.title: Flight of the Amazon Queen for PC
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case with insert, manual, registration card and installation guide in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
Flight of the Amazon Queen is a point and click adventure where you play Joe King as he uses his plane, the Amazon Queen, to fly famous actress Faye Russell to a film shoot. When the plane crash lands in a remote jungle, and he must use his wits to battle his way out of the dangers he faces.

As with many point and click adventures, a set of icons at the bottom of the screen allows the player to interact with other characters or the environment. The game has since been ported to smartphones, with the addition of improved graphics, full voice acting, multi-language support and a play through of the interactive interview mini-game with audio commentary by John Passfield, one of the game’s designers.

constellations_primary.name: Gender bending larrikins
constellations_primary.description: Australia has a long history with gender creativity and drag culture, both on screen and on stage.
